item.title: How to make gfx move with the player?
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“zez1ma boy, post:5, topic:177002”][quote author=leder678 link=topic=237816.msg2021622#msg2021622 date=1201658505]
This is how i do it:

stillgfx(332, absY, absX);

Just change the 332 to the number you want, and have no timer on…

I think that probaly should work…
[/quote]
Thats a standing still one LMAO!!!
READ the post before you say something!!!
I need help with this too =([/quote]

Actually your wrong, and he’s right, although part of what you said is right.

It will only do it where your standing once, but if you call it under the process, it will be just a like a ‘glow’ thing someone mentioned above.

So like:

if(gfx) { stillgfx(id, absX, absY); }

So for every step you take, it will make that gfx, thus appearing ‘in a moving motion’.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make gfx move with the player?

item.title: How to make gfx move with the player?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

I’ve tryed this

public void playerGfx(int id, int delay) {
mask100var1 = id;
mask100var2 = delay;
mask100update = true;
updateRequired = true;
}

And it works in one server, RicScape, but not in my server, so does anyone have one which can make the gfx stay with the player, thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make gfx move with the player?
